content.title: Internship Policy Of Indian Council For Cultural Relations (ICCR)
content.details: The Internship Policy of ICCR outlines the selection procedure, responsibilities, and rights of interns during their internship program.
benefits: Exposure to cultural relations and activities
eligibility: Students and recent graduates from recognized institutions
Must be able to commit to the internship duration
exclusions: Interns cannot use the outcome of their study without prior approval
Interns who opt out will be barred from future internships
content.application_process: Candidates must apply online through the ICCR website and will be selected based on a two-stage process: Preliminary Screening and Personal Interview.

faqs.question: What is the selection procedure for the internship program offered by ICCR?
faqs.answer: The selection procedure consists of two stages: Preliminary Screening and Personal Interview.

faqs.question: How many candidates will be called for the personal interview stage?
faqs.answer: The total number of candidates called for interviews will be three times the number of interns to be engaged each year.

faqs.question: Who conducts the preliminary screening and personal interviews for the internship program?
faqs.answer: Both the Preliminary Screening and Personal Interviews are conducted by separate Committees comprising not less than three ICCR officials in each Committee.

faqs.question: How many candidates will be selected for internships?
faqs.answer: A maximum of 15 candidates will be selected from the interview process and offered internships.

faqs.question: Can the ICCR terminate the internship program at any time?
faqs.answer: Yes, ICCR reserves the right to instruct interns to terminate the program at any time without providing a reason.

faqs.question: Can interns choose to leave the program if they wish to do so?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns have the option to leave the program by providing a one-month prior notice to ICCR.

faqs.question: Who owns the outcome of the study during the internship?
faqs.answer: The outcome of the study during the internship remains the intellectual property of ICCR.

faqs.question: Are interns required to maintain confidentiality regarding ICCR-related information?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns are required to maintain full confidentiality and secrecy of any information relating to ICCR.

faqs.question: What is the process for verifying and vetting interns from a security perspective?
faqs.answer: Verification and vetting from a security angle will be conducted based on the personal particulars submitted by the intern.

faqs.question: Do interns need to submit a declaration of secrecy before starting the internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns are required to furnish a declaration of secrecy to ICCR before the commencement of the internship.

faqs.question: Is there any specific timeline for the selection process and issuance of internship offers?
faqs.answer: The selection process is ongoing, and the timeline may vary based on the requirements of ICCR.

faqs.question: What happens if a selected candidate opts out of the internship program?
faqs.answer: If a selected candidate decides to opt out, they will be barred from future internships.

faqs.question: Can interns use the outcome of their study during the internship without prior approval from ICCR?
faqs.answer: No, interns are not permitted to use the outcome of their study without prior approval from ICCR.

faqs.question: What are the responsibilities of interns during the internship program?
faqs.answer: Interns are expected to be punctual, maintain a logbook, follow a code of conduct, and submit a project report.

faqs.question: How is the training report verified at the end of the internship?
faqs.answer: The training report is verified by the respective Unit Head or departmental head.

faqs.question: Will interns receive a certificate upon successful completion of the internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, upon successful completion, ICCR will issue a certificate to the interns.

faqs.question: Are interns provided with any financial assistance for travel expenses or accommodation?
faqs.answer: No, interns are responsible for their own travel expenses.

faqs.question: Can interns use the information related to ICCR after the internship without prior approval?
faqs.answer: No, interns are required to maintain confidentiality even after the completion of the internship.

faqs.question: How are internships terminated if necessary?
faqs.answer: ICCR can instruct interns to terminate the program at any time without providing a reason.
